attributes.action: Apply the same rules to mobile speed cameras as apply to fixed speed cameras.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The rules regarding placement of fixed speed cameras are relatively sensible:
placement must be in an accident blackspot; they are made very visible; warning signs are put up and their locations are published.

Mobile speed cameras, by contrast, are not placed in accident blackspots; can be hidden in vans with no visible markings and are normally positioned in sites designed to generate the maximum amount of income (e.g. on a bridge after a bend on a downhill stretch of motorway - M4 Bridgend).

We have no objection to speed cameras where their use can be seen to be in the interests of public safety. The current rules once again leave the Road Safety Partnerships open to the accusation of "money-grabbing" tactics in their placement of mobile speed cameras.
